body.name: TIAJO Nonstick Deep Frying Pan, No Fumes Skillet, Stone-Derived Coating, Compatible with All Stovetops (Gas, Electric & Induction), Send 1 Sponge, PFOA Free, Gray (11 Inch Lidless)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 6 hrs 9 mins
features: Multi-functional Deep Fry Pan: This versatile 11-inch nonstick pan can function as both a frying pan and a wok, with which you can fry, stir-fry, deep-fry, sear, braise, and boil.

Heats Quickly & Evenly: The Heavy-duty skillet with 3-layer metal thicken induction compatible bottom, conducts heat quickly. Even heat distribution allows cooking quickly, saves time and energy. The nonstick interior of the frying pan is made of cast aluminum, which is more durable and sturdy, warp-resistance, makes the heats delivery much quicker than normal cast iron.

Nonstick Mai Fan Stone Coating: This skillet features an interior Mai Fan stone nonstick coating that prevents food from sticking or scorching during cooking. It is easy to clean, saving you time and effort.

Suitable for all Stoves: This nonstick skillet features a perfectly magnetized base that works on most stovetops. Compatible with electromagnetic stoves, gas stoves, electric stoves, ceramic stoves, halogen stoves as well as solid fuel stoves. Not suitable for oven or dishwasher use.
Heat-Resistant Bakelite Handle: The bakelite handle features an ergonomic design that is comfortable to grip, slip-resistant and stays cool during cooking.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Nonstick Mai Fan Stone Coating Superior nonstick coating, Make cooking easier.PFOA FREE, non-toxic.Cast aluminum interior. Bakelite Handle Faux wood grain handle design, fresh and natural.Ergonomic design provides a comfortable grip.Scald-proof handle with cooling touch. Magnetic Conductive Bottom Tri-ply reinforced Stainless steel induction base.Fast cooking, uniform heat distribution.Suitable for all stove. Easy To Clean Easy to wipe and clean.Do not clean with steel wool.Hand washing preserves non-stick performance for extended use.

Why Buy TIAJO Nonstick Skillet？ Cook for your loved ones using TIAJO Nonstick Deep Frying Pans (available in two sizes, with or without lid to suit your cooking needs). These frying pans feature an advanced Mai fan Stone coating, using a triple-layer stone-derived coating technique to enhance cooking performance without any toxic or irritating chemicals. Even amateur cooks can whip up a hearty family meal. Let you and your family enjoy healthy, hassle-free home cooking. TIAJO is a professional company devoted to R&D, production and providing high-quality cookware at reasonable prices. Founded in 1995, we distribute products directly from our factory. We are dedicated to offering our customers the highly value-for-money products.

USE & CARE 1.It is best to use silicone or wooden tools. 2.Cook over low or medium heat. Do not heat the empty pan. 3.Just a little oil is needed to prevent food from sticking. 4.To hand wash, use a soft sponge, warm water, and dishwashing soap. 5.The cooking temperature should not exceed 482°F/250°C.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Decent little frying pan
reviews.reviewText: It's one of the smaller pans I own, but probably the correct size for what I cook :) It does seem to take a little longer to heat up than my other pans, but my other pans are not induction compatible. I'm not sure if that is the reason why it takes longer, just the only explanation I can think of. It did a pretty good job of cooking food without it sticking to the pan and burning and any left over foods came right off the pan during clean up. My two 12" pans are getting old and this one is meant to replace those, even though it's smaller in size. So far I like the results I'm getting with this pan. I plan to use this for a few more days, then throw away my 12" pans if this one works well enough and sized big enough for what I cook. Since all my pans are larger than this one, I don't seem to have any lids that will fit, so that kind of sucks.I like the handle, it has a nice feel to it. It seems to have a good grip to it as well. Whatever that material is that it's made of feels nice to the touch. It's supposed to stay cool while cooking and so far I haven't noticed the handle heat up even a little bit, so I'm guessing that's true.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice durable pan
reviews.reviewText: I recently ordered the Nonstick Deep Frying Pan from Amazon, and I must say it exceeded my expectations in many ways. In this review, I will provide an unbiased assessment focusing on its value for money, nonstick properties, weight, giftable appeal, and sturdiness, to give potential buyers a comprehensive understanding of this product.First and foremost, the value for money provided by this frying pan is exceptional. Its affordable price tag makes it accessible to a wide range of customers without compromising on quality. Considering its performance, durability, and the delicious meals it helps create, it offers excellent value for every penny spent.The nonstick surface of this frying pan is outstanding. It effortlessly releases food without leaving any residue, making cooking and cleaning up a breeze. This feature is a game-changer for anyone who enjoys hassle-free cooking experiences. The nonstick coating also contributes to healthier cooking, as it reduces the need for excessive oil or butter, promoting low-fat and nutritious meals.In terms of weight, the frying pan strikes a perfect balance. It is neither too heavy nor too light, allowing for easy handling and maneuverability in the kitchen. The ergonomic design ensures comfortable use, making it suitable for everyday cooking tasks.The pan’s giftable appeal is undeniable. Its sleek design and high-quality construction make it an excellent gift choice for cooking enthusiasts. Whether it’s for a housewarming party, a wedding, or any other special occasion, this frying pan is sure to impress recipients. Its practicality, combined with an attractive appearance, makes it a thoughtful and practical gift option.One of the standout features of this frying pan is its sturdiness. Despite its lightweight design, the pan feels robust and well-made. It is built to endure high heat levels and heavy use, ensuring long-term durability. The sturdy construction adds to the overall reliability of the product, making it a kitchen essential that can withstand the test of time.Key Points:The Nonstick Deep Frying Pan offers exceptional value for money, providing high-quality performance at an affordable price.Its nonstick surface ensures effortless food release and easy cleaning, promoting healthy cooking practices.The pan’s weight strikes a perfect balance, offering ease of use and comfortable handling during cooking.Its giftable appeal makes it an excellent choice for various occasions, allowing users to share the joy of hassle-free cooking.The frying pan’s sturdiness is impressive, ensuring long-lasting durability and reliability for everyday cooking needs.In conclusion, the Nonstick Deep Frying Pan is a reliable kitchen companion that delivers outstanding performance at an affordable price. Its nonstick properties, balanced weight, giftable appeal, and sturdiness make it a top choice for both novice and experienced cooks. Whether you're preparing a quick breakfast or a gourmet dinner, this frying pan is sure to enhance your culinary adventures. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a reliable and efficient cooking tool that offers great value for money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It is non-stick, but doesn't work on my induction cooktop
reviews.reviewText: I really like this skillet, it is so easy to clean, and it has been non-stick on everything I have cooked so far. The description does say it is induction cooktop useable, but so far I have not gotten it to work on my induction cooktop at all. The bottom is built up nicely, and does transfer heat well on my electric stove, and it does seem to distribute that heat evenly. I wouldn't hesitate to buy another one of these skillets.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Great quality pan! I absolutely love it. Worth every penny!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Nonstick? Not hardly...
reviews.reviewText: Pan arrived in a simple cardboard box with the handle detached, and no product insert or use/care instructions. Everything looked nice and shiny, I had to use a long thin Phillips #2 screwdriver to securely attach the handle with the provided screw (handle hole angle necessitated long thin screwdriver). Finish of the pan is interesting appearance, looked to be without blemish. Pan feels firm and light. Handle looks like wood grained, but it's not wood (identified as bakelite in the product description), and it definitely stays cool when the rest of the pan heats up.I tried out the pan on an induction cook top -- it heated quickly and evenly. When it was sufficiently warm I cracked open one egg and poured into the pan, with a little water (for steam), and put a lid on it (glass lid I already had in the kitchen; no lid included with this pan).I think it was my first time ever, being able to observe the egg as it cooked. I was able to get a perfectly cooked sunny-side-up egg with no problem, up to this point.I turned off the heat and tipped the pan, expecting the egg to slide out of the pan and onto a slice of bread I had ready to receive it just like in the promo video... no movement. I tipped the pan almost vertical, the perfectly cooked egg stayed firmly stuck to the pan surface. I had to dislodge the egg from the pan with a spatula (egg tasted great, btw). Afterward, I scraped the pan with the spatula, the photo is what I scraped up.Maybe the pan needs to be treated or conditioned before cooking with it? I don't know, there were no instructions to tell me what to do. It worked great after I sprayed it with canola oil (second egg slid out slick as a whistle), but if I'm promised non-stick cooking right out of the box, that's what needs to happen. Grrrr...
